    • Method Detail

      • getAppVersionName

        public static String getAppVersionName(Context context)
                                throws PackageManager.NameNotFoundException
        Gets the value of the "versionName" attribute defined in the AndroidManifest.xml. Since v.5.9.0.2.a, SDK provides the ability to set a custom appVersionName value. (See @link PaydiantApplicationConfig.setCustomAppVersionName(String)). If this is set, it'll return as the appVersionName.
        Parameters:
        context - - Android app context
        Returns:
        value of the "versionName" attribute defined in the AndroidManifest.xml. Since v.5.9.0.2.a, if PaydiantApplicationConfig.setCustomAppVersionName(String)) is set, then "custom appVersionName" value will be returned.
        Throws:
        PackageManager.NameNotFoundException
        Since:
        4.8.0.1
        See Also:
        PaydiantApplicationConfig.setCustomAppVersionName(String)

      • getAppVersionCode

        public static int getAppVersionCode(Context context)
                             throws PackageManager.NameNotFoundException
        Gets the value of the "versionCode" attribute defined in the AndroidManifest.xml.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

        Throws:

      • getApplictionLabel

        public static String getApplictionLabel(Context context)
                                 throws Resources.NotFoundException
        Gets the android:label value defined in the AndroidManifest.xml.
        Parameters:
        context -
        Returns:
        android:label value defined in the AndroidManifest.xml or null if its not defined.
        Throws:
        Resources.NotFoundException

      • isAppInBackground

        public static boolean isAppInBackground(Context context)
        Checks whether the application is running in the background
        Returns:
        true if the app is running in the background, false otherwise.

      • isDeviceRooted

        @Deprecated
public static boolean isDeviceRooted(Context context)
        Deprecated. Not recommended for use in Android apps
        Checks whether the device is rooted 

         Note: This isDeviceRooted() method is just to check whether the users device is rooted or
 not and this SHOULD NOT be used as means of securing data.
 
 There might be other applications that prevent detecting a rooted device, so this method can provide an incorrect
 value. Therefore please make necessary arrangement to secure your data.
        Returns:
        true, if is the device rooted
        Since:
        4.4.0.3
